alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 18 at 2:25PM EDT until April 19 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...High Fire Danger Expected across East Central Florida Tuesday Afternoon... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR BREEZY CONDITIONS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND ELEVATED ERC NUMBERS ACROSS THE INTERIOR OF EAST CENTRAL FLORIDA... The National Weather Service in Melbourne has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * AFFECTED AREA... Inland Volusia... Northern Lake... Orange... Seminole... Osceola... Okeechobee... Southern Lake. * WIND...North to North-Northeast at 15 to 20 mph with frequent higher gusts. * HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 25 to 35 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County
